definition[0]: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later
example[1]: The seeds remain dormant until the spring.
definition[1]: something that is dormant has not been active for a long time, although it may become active in the future
example[2]: The project lay dormant for two years until we found a co-sponsor.
example[3]: Someone tampered with IBM systems by planting a dormant bug due to wipe out whole data banks on Friday 13th.
